question.title: Java - How to get Windows network drive full path from drive letter
question.body:
In Java, I've created a program for internal users to create mappings in our database to locations on our network drives. I'm doing this by getting a java.io.File object from a javax.swing JFileChooser.

The problem is once I have the File object, the Strings returned by getAbsolutePath & getCanonicalPath contain the local drive letter (e.g. N:\myDir\myFile.dat) when I need the full drive path (e.g. \\shared-drive\..\myDir\myFile.dat).

I'd prefer a native Java solution but I'm not opposed to using external libraries as long as I can build from the source.

I tried using the getSystemDisplayName method from javax.swing FileSystemView, it did not seem to return the correct result.
